ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really enjoyed this class. I learned how to be creative again expand on knowledge on effective notes.
A broader sense of what art is and can be; how to engage with and navigate Yale's extensive art collections
New ways to taking notes instead of solely bullet points (drawing first thing that comes to mind, recreating image, collage, pictures, etc.)

I learned how to challenge my thinking every day, to understand the best ways that I learn, to explore all of Yale's resources and understand how to use them, and to expand my understanding of what art can be.
Challenging my perceptions and learning how to view daily objects differently
rethinking what art is
I learned a lot about modern art.
different forms of art
I expanded my definition of art drastically.
I learned the ability to identify different forms of art with different forms of composition. I also learned a lot of insightful history with art.
How to think outside the box when looking at art, considering alternative forms of note-taking, thinking more creatively

Art 014 retrained my brain; it prompted me to perceive and engage with art in new ways. I also learned new notetaking methods, and I engaged with Yale's art resources; This course is a fantastic opportunity to take advantage of all Yale offers.
I learned how to take notes through various methods, besides just your normal bullet point method. I saw art through a different perspective and found new meanings of art.

New awareness of the complexities of the art world far beyond Van Gogh, Picasso, and Da Vinci. I was exposed to several concepts which appeared in other courses I was taking, as well as the ability to draw inferences and make arguments based on new information.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It would be nice to receive feedback earlier in the semester.  I haven't received a single grade all year and have no idea where my grade stands.
I really liked this class. Very organized and engaging.

Strengths: being challenged to think critically about art in a low pressure, low workload environment; having the chance to explore Yale's art resources
Weaknesses: 3 hour long classes without breaks

I think this course is strong in its diversity and interactiveness, as well as fulfilling its main course objectives. However, the seminar could feel a bit prolonged at times given it's a three hour course.
The strengths of this class is how it is tailored to the students, the weekly field-trip-like classes, and discussion that provoke creative thinking. The 3 hour segment is a little long.
long classes, some interesting topics, unclear instructions
This course was well designed but more interactive activities could be utilized to better the experience.
This course was very good, i would say that there should be somewhat of a more of a clarified structure for this course but the info was really good.

Strengths- not a lot of work to do outside of class time
Weaknesses- 3 hours is a long time for one class, very repetitive in the notes we had to take, not allowed to take notes in bullet form, I don't think I learned a lot of new things after the first few classes

Professor Schneider has ZERO rules and few expectations. I frequently questioned whether I was doing the class correctly throughout the semester. For those of us (like me) that appreciate structure, this class is tough. But it is also an excellent opportunity to be creative; how you operate in Art 014the work you produce and the notes you takeis up to you.

Strengths: amazing classroom atmosphere, facilitated free and unjudged discussion
Weaknesses: we did not receive grades for the course on any intermediate assignments, or much feedback regarding our involvement in the course

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!!! It was such a fun class and I learned so much about artworks and how to be an effective note-taker. I professor was amazing and very engaging.
I would recommend this course to another student if they are looking to explore Yale's numerous art galleries, exhibits, collections etc. and want to think critically about art
Recommend to STEM majors as an easy humanities credit.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student, especially anyone who is not originally in the arts of humanities.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. Class was very interesting and taught you to engage with art in nonstandard views.
I would definitely recommend this course to non-art students mainly because of its encompassing freedom.
Yes, you get to see very interesting places at Yale that arent very well-known. I especially enjoyed the field trips during class.
Yes- fun class, very different from other classes I've taken in the past
Yes! Every lesson takes place in a new location; it is an excellent opportunity to explore Yale's art collections and resources.
Absolutely. It has been one of my favorite classes I have taken at Yale so far and it is an amazing first year seminar.

Yes, I think it is a fantastic introduction to the art world and also a great way to make new freshmen friends. I think the class is a low-stress environment that is beneficial to the mind and helps students recognize their potential. We also had a lot of freedom to choose what we wanted to focus on for our final project which really allowed us to utilize our creativity and try to connect what we have learned across disciplines.
